question: Which is the continuous form of 'I play'?
explanation: To form the present continuous, we use 'am/is/are' + verb-ing.

question: 'She has eaten' is in the present perfect tense. (True / False)
explanation: 'Has eaten' is the present perfect form, using 'has' + past participle.

question: Fill in the blank: The past perfect continuous of 'run' is 'She _____ running.' (has been / had been)
explanation: Past perfect continuous uses 'had been' + verb-ing.

question: Which is the future perfect form of 'I will study'?
explanation: Future perfect uses 'will have' + past participle.

question: What is the present continuous form of 'They sing'?
explanation: Present continuous uses 'am/is/are' + verb-ing.

question: 'He had played' is in the past perfect tense. (True / False)
explanation: Past perfect uses 'had' + past participle.

question: Fill in the blank: The present perfect continuous of 'work' is 'We _____ working.' (have been / had been)
explanation: Present perfect continuous uses 'have/has been' + verb-ing.

question: Which is the past continuous form of 'She wrote'?
explanation: Past continuous uses 'was/were' + verb-ing.

question: What is the future continuous form of 'They will dance'?
explanation: Future continuous uses 'will be' + verb-ing.

question: 'We have been reading' is in the present perfect continuous tense. (True / False)
explanation: Present perfect continuous uses 'have/has been' + verb-ing.

question: Fill in the blank: The past perfect of 'eat' is 'He _____ eaten.' (has / had)
explanation: Past perfect uses 'had' + past participle.

question: Which is the present perfect form of 'I swim'?
explanation: Present perfect uses 'have/has' + past participle.

question: What is the future perfect continuous form of 'They will play'?
explanation: Future perfect continuous uses 'will have been' + verb-ing.

question: 'She is singing' is in the present continuous tense. (True / False)
explanation: Present continuous uses 'am/is/are' + verb-ing.

question: Fill in the blank: The future perfect of 'finish' is 'You _____ finished.' (will have / will has)
explanation: Future perfect uses 'will have' + past participle.

question: Which is the past perfect continuous form of 'He ran'?
explanation: Past perfect continuous uses 'had been' + verb-ing.

question: What is the present perfect form of 'They go'?
explanation: Present perfect uses 'have/has' + past participle.

question: 'We will have been working' is in the future perfect continuous tense. (True / False)
explanation: Future perfect continuous uses 'will have been' + verb-ing.

question: Fill in the blank: The past continuous of 'sleep' is 'I _____ sleeping.' (were / was)
explanation: Past continuous uses 'was/were' + verb-ing.

question: Which is the present continuous form of 'It rains'?
explanation: Present continuous uses 'am/is/are' + verb-ing.

question: What is the past perfect form of 'We saw'?
explanation: Past perfect uses 'had' + past participle.

question: Fill in the blank: The present perfect continuous of 'study' is 'He _____ studying.' (had been / has been)
explanation: Present perfect continuous uses 'have/has been' + verb-ing.

question: Which is the future perfect form of 'They will win'?
explanation: Future perfect uses 'will have' + past participle.

question: What is the past continuous form of 'You walked'?
explanation: Past continuous uses 'was/were' + verb-ing.

question: What is the present perfect continuous form of 'They work'?
explanation: Present perfect continuous uses 'have/has been' + verb-ing.
